0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Verify cargo documents and customs forms to ensure accuracy and completeness
Evaluate risks associated with shipments to determine best course of action for customs clearance
Prepare and submit declarations for shipments to regulatory authorities
Determine duties, taxes, and other fees owed on imported goods
Negotiate with suppliers and carriers to resolve disputes over shipment details
Conduct inspections to verify cargo contents against shipping documents
Identify potential security threats and take corrective action to mitigate risks
Comply with regulatory requirements and industry standards for customs clearance
Counse importers and exporters on compliance regulations and procedures
Coordinate shipments with multiple stakeholders, including carriers and suppliers
Maintain accurate records of shipment details, including tracking numbers and cargo status
Process payments and collect duties owed on imported goods
Handle customer inquiries and resolve issues related to customs clearance
Collaborate with law enforcement agencies to investigate potential smuggling operations
Participate in international trade organizations and industry forums to stay up-to-date on regulations and best practices
Analyze data to identify trends and patterns in shipment volumes and cargo values
Prepare reports and presentations for clients and stakeholders to track shipments and cargo details
Hire, train, and supervise staff as needed to support customs clearance operations
Conduct audits of supplier records and cargo documentation to ensure compliance with regulations
Issue warnings and fines for non-compliance with customs regulations
Coordinate with regulatory authorities to resolve disputes over shipment details or penalties
1: Spearhead new employee onboarding programs to ensure a smooth transition into the organization.
Develop and implement corporate training programs that align with business objectives and industry best practices.
Evaluate existing training content to identify areas for improvement and update materials accordingly.
Assess the needs of various departments within the company and design customized training solutions.
Codify best practices and create employee handbooks and policy manuals that reflect organizational standards.
Foster a culture of continuous learning by identifying opportunities for professional development and growth.
Design and deliver training programs for leadership development, including executive coaching and mentoring.
Develop and manage budgets for training initiatives, ensuring ROI and aligning with overall business goals.
Build and maintain relationships with external vendors and partners to secure expertise and resources for training needs.
Hire, train, and supervise a team of trainers and instructional designers who deliver high-quality learning experiences.
Solicit feedback from employees and stakeholders to inform the development of new training programs and make data-driven decisions.
2: Prepare menu according to restaurant or institutional standards
Prepares ingredients in accordance with a recipe or food safety guidelines
Assess kitchen layout and equipment needs for efficient food preparation
Safely receives and stores deliveries of food, beverages, and other supplies
Sanitizes and cleans the kitchen area including appliances and surfaces
Serves customers or residents in an institution by providing meals
Presents food in a neat and appealing manner to enhance customer satisfaction
Folks and serves dishes from food stations according to dining schedule
Maintains organization of food preparation areas to optimize efficiency
Follows recipes, cooking methods, and food safety protocols to produce quality dishes
Washes utensils, equipment, and food handling surfaces as required
Inspects food for quality and appearance before serving it to customers or residents
